comment.author: 47568208@N00
comment._content: JUDGE H.D. CLAYTON OF ALABAMA DEAD; Federal Jurist and Former Congressman Succumbs to Anemia at 72. ANTI-TRUST ACT'S AUTHOR Sent to House Eight Times--Headed Judiciary Committee--Once Democratic Convention Chairman. from NY Times Archive

comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: Henry De Lamar Clayton (1857-1929) was an Alabama Democrat who served in the U.S. House of Representatives from 1897 to 1914, after which he served as a Federal Judge in his home state. Biographical Directory of the U.S. Congress.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks! We'll fix the name in the source data and reload the description.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo of the mysterious Mr. Rossom. Or should it be Russom? or Rossum? Or is he playing Possum? Google seems never to have heard of the guy. The man to his left in this photo is of course Congressman H. D. Clayton of Alabama -- with or without a face:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2851192520/]
